lexUnit.name: suffer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: experience or be subjected to (something bad or unpleasant).

sentence.text: The five-strong crew thought they were about to suffer the same disaster that struck another British Airways flight in June 1990 .
The Stewarts suffered a sequence of disasters which would almost suggest that some evil magician had set a curse upon the entire house .
The researchers say in some cases the after effects can compare with those suffered by survivors of major tragedies like the Zebrugree disaster .

The Highlanders suffered such heavy losses in the assault on the village that the attack on Delville Wood was assigned to the South African Infantry Brigade , who had earlier been allotted merely mopping-up operations .
Among the Arabs , Saudi Arabia , which had invested great prestige in the plan , has suffered the biggest setback .
Peace negotiations suffered a serious setback in April following a major mujaheddin offensive against the town of Khost which eventually fell to the rebels [ see p. 38153 ] .
He and others fear that ` safety net " losses to be suffered by some areas will cost them key metropolitan councils in next May 's elections .
When I returned to the drawing room , a clergyman was talking about the hardships being suffered by children in Berlin .
Most damage was suffered by salmon farms , which had to destroy all fish born in 1991 .
3.2 The problems in applying the rule arise when the damage which has been suffered is not financial .
In actuality it was the poorer peasants who grumbled louder and suffered more from taxation , as Yakovlev was to discover for himself a year later in Tambov guberniia .
A year-long survey of Edinburgh has shown much of the city to be suffering from severe air pollution .
The Institute itself has , of course , suffered financially from the impact of the recession and has had to make painful economies and cut out some activities .
Another play area -- at Joseph Gardens , Silver End -- suffers from youths congregating at nights causing problems for nearby residents , the survey revealed .
The food shortages suffered by people in Russia have been well publicised , but the effects of this on the country 's pets have been even more dramatic .
Like other ` Third World " nations , the Arab people had suffered and continue to suffer as a result of colonialism and imperialism .
This is the very last thing that should ever suffer in a time of recession or emergency when people 's belts have to tighten .
This should effectively see off any disease which it appears the Regal Tang is suffering from .
Lyall 's more obliquely modernist approach to harmony was less readily integrated , while the piano suffered from being too low in the sound-mix .
While many other countries suffer more -- and more violent -- crime , it is still a worrying feature of our own society .
And social services suffered too , as they always will when wealth creation is despised .
Both countries have suffered prison violence , disorder and breakouts .
Hereford are suffering something of a flu epedemic at the moment .
This toll bridge was at Whitney suffered damage from the fast flowing flood , and parts of Hereford are already underwater .
Fitzgerald departed 48 hours after his team suffered yet another record defeat , Australia winning 42-17 in Dublin .
